poem:
Title: "An Order of Safety"

Mornings herald change,
each sale and transaction
scrutinized,
in the murmuring marketplace,
or the whispering web.

The Justice, standing, mandating.
Background checks,
an embroidery of safety,
tightening the weave.

Many a gun's hymn, now heard.
Regardless, the where,
the infinite internet, 
the bustling bazaar,
all under a common sky.

Changes announced,
on this Thursday, waking,
in the pliable palms
of human care.
